DataElement.preferredDefinition: A sequence of letters, numbers, or other characters that uniquely identifies a biospecimen obtained for research purposes.  The MCL biospecimen identifier which is comprised of the MCL participant identifier and a unique specimen number (ex. MCL75_001_10100).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A consortium consisting of independent, multi-disciplinary teams that undertake comprehensive molecular and cellular characterizations of tumor tissue, cell, and microenvironment components to distinguish screen-detected early lesions from interval and symptom-detected cancers._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Consortium for Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screen-Detected Lesions
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A consortium consisting of independent, multi-disciplinary teams that undertake comprehensive molecular and cellular characterizations of tumor tissue, cell, and microenvironment components to distinguish screen-detected early lesions from interval and symptom-detected cancers.

Concepts.longName: Consortium for Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screen-Detected Lesions
Concepts.definition: A consortium consisting of independent, multi-disciplinary teams that undertake comprehensive molecular and cellular characterizations of tumor tissue, cell, and microenvironment components to distinguish screen-detected early lesions from interval and symptom-detected cancers.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.origin: MCL:Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screened Lesions
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/21/22 mr Released per SME.   1/26/22 mr Created for MCL Biospecimen according to DCT.

ReferenceDocuments.name: MCL-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Identifier format is MCL participant id+specimen type+sample number where specimen type is 1 for tissue, 2 for blood, 3 for DNA, and 4 for RNA. For example, MCL78_005_40135 identifies an RNA sample for participant 5 from the University of Vermont.

ReferenceDocuments.name: MCL-Template
ReferenceDocuments.description: MCL specimen identifier, for each specimen including derivative specimens.

ReferenceDocuments.name: MCL-Biospecimen
ReferenceDocuments.description: Format: _   Definitions for specimen type: 1 = tissue 2 = blood 3 =  DNA 4 = RNA  Examples: MCL75_001_10001 MCL78_005_40135

ReferenceDocuments.name: MCL-Biospecimen-2
ReferenceDocuments.description: MCL specimen identifier, for each specimen including derivative specimens.

DataElement.origin: MCL:Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screened Lesions
DataElement.changeDescription: 3/23/22 mr Added LabCAS CSI.   3/21/22 mr Released per SME.   2/3/22 jk Upd data to use MCL specific format VD.  12/13/21 mr Added AQT, alt def, ref doc, coding instructions and CSI for MCL Biospecimen per DCT.  2021-3-29 ak Removed Reference Doc "MCL-Template Field Name" specimen_id and added as alt name.  10/16/20 jk added MCL Biospecimen CSI; MCL Template label. 6/4/20 jk Derived CDE to capture specimen sample identifier.
